conversations.content: You! Are you Euden?
Yes, that's me. Why do you ask?
And you are accompanied by two women...
Er, and what does that have to do with anything?
Hm?
Then it seems the rumors were true...
You beast! This calls for the Loving Hand!
Sorry, did you just say the Loving Ha—
Take this!
Gya! ...Huh?
That...didn't hurt at all. Which is strange, because it SOUNDED like it should have done some serious damage.
The Loving Hand is not meant to hurt!
Interesting...
Look, can we maybe talk about why a strange lady just walked up and slapped me in the face?
My name is Estelle. I am a preacher.
As an advocate for the teachings of the Church, I can't allow your wretched behavior to go unpunished!
The heck did I do?
There is no shortage of rumors with you at their core...
One of which claims that you surround yourself with young women in that castle of yours and engage in all manner of... of...of indecencies!
WHAT?!
And now I see you with my own eyes, flanked on either side by women fair!
What exactly are you implying?
I-indeed! Wh-whatever you think our... r-relationship is, you are quite mistaken!
She's right. This is all just one big misunderstanding...
Is that so? Hmm. Then it seems I allowed myself to be fooled by hearsay.
I apologize for acting rashly before I fully understood the situation.
Well, it didn't really hurt, so I guess... Anyway, I'm just glad we got it cleared up.
There's nothing special between Cleo or Elisanne and myself. We're just friends.
Hmph. Is that so?
Nothing...special...? I...I see...
Did the temperature just drop...?
Whatever do you mean? This is how people act when there is nothing special between them.
Indeed. We are nothing more than friends, after all.
I am so confused right now...
Now I understand... You are a villain!
Oh, come on!
It would be remiss of me to let you out of my sight even for a moment.
So I will stay here and make certain you do not do anything untoward!
I have no idea what's happening here...
But I feel like I just got myself into some major trouble.
Hyaaah! Hah!
Hm...
*pant* *pant* Phew...
Do you train that hard every day?
It's the only way I'll get stronger.
...It seems I owe you an apology.
What for?
The more I watch you, the more I come to see you for who you really are.
You are an honest, hardworking, and beloved man.
I'm sorry I ever doubted your integrity.
Ah. That.
Well, don't worry about it. It's not like your doubting me did any lasting harm.
But the whole reason you came here was to watch over me, right?
True.
If you don't need to do so anymore, does that mean you're going to leave?
Hey, there's our teacher! Reverend Esteeeelle!
Children!
Whatcha doin', Reverend? ...Oooo! Are you on a daaaate?!
Silence! I will hear no more of this foolishness!
Ha ha ha! You're in trouuuble!
Run awaaay!
What was that about you being their teacher?
Wherever there is a shortage of teachers, preachers must step in to help the children with their studies.
A teacher, eh? Hmm...
Do you have a problem with that?!
Not at all. I think it suits you.
W-well... Anyway, back to what we were discussing...
You mean about you leaving?
What? You're leaving, Reverend?!
Noooo! You can't leeeave!
Calm down, children. I'm not going anywhere.
Really?
Yes. Really.
Yaaaaay!
Are you sure you want to stay, Estelle?
Leaving now would be tantamount to abandoning these children.
A preacher cannot be so irresponsible.
Well, that's good.
What?
The children aren't the only ones who would be sad if you left, you know? I would be, too.
Revereeeeend! Your face is soooo red!
Estelle and Euden, sittin' in a tree! K-I-S—
STOP THAT THIS INSTANT!
You really are a villain, Euden!
This calls for the Loving Hand!
What?! Why?!
Take THIS!
Gaaaaah!
What was that scream?! ...Huh?
What's this bug cage doing here?
Euden?!
Estelle? What's wrong?
Don't give me that! Was it you?! Were you the one that threw bugs into my room?
Why would I do something like that?
Hngggh...
What are you staring at...? Oh! The cage?
Look, it was just sitting here. I don't know where it came from, I swear.
I know it sounds like I'm making up excuses, but it... I... Um...
A-are you gonna...?
...No. Now that I think about it, you really have no reason to act in such a manner.
Oh, good. Um...sorry?
Why? It isn't as if you have anything to apologize for. ...Riiight?
True, but I...just felt like I should say it.
*sigh* You are a strange one. Sometimes your kindness gets the better of you.
Is that so? Um, ha ha...
Over heeere!
Huh? I think someone's calling me.
Wh-what the—?!
Why is there a laundry bucket here? Tsk! The floor's all wet. I better hurry and mop this up...
Ah, Estelle! Be careful!
Huh? Aaaaaahhh!
Owww... For Ilia's sake, why is the floor covered in suds?!
Sorry! But it wasn't me! Or... Well, I guess it was, actually.
Hmmm...
I know that you are not the kind of person to do this as some sort of prank...
But still, I would appreciate a bit more consideration! People could slip and hurt themselves, you know.
Uh...yeah. Sorry...
Thanks for helping me organize this room, Estelle.
You are most welcome. I must say, though, it's rather odd for royalty to engage in tasks like this.
Whether a person is royalty or not doesn't matter much around here. Now then, it should be riiight baaack...
This room is certainly...＂cozy.＂ And dusty. And full of all sorts of strange things.
Gah! What happened to the lights?!
Gaaah! Oh, Goddess!
Estelle! Estelle, are you okay?! Aahhh!
What the—! Gaaaah!
Owww... S-sorry, Estelle... Something caught my leg...
I-it's fine... But could...could you just move, maybe?
Ah—right!
Phew... That was terrible...
I should be the one saying that!
Ah! Sorry...
Honestly, will your tomfoolery never end?!
I-I'm sorry! But I don't mean to—
Not you. ...You might as well come out! I know you're there!
Huh?
Heh, guess you found me...
What?! When did this kid get in here?!
You realize you've been the target of all those pranks, right? Well, you're looking at the culprit.
Hey! You just ratted me out!
Of course, I would never allow you to get away with such behavior! You've earned yourself a Loving Hand!
There!
Again? You know that doesn't even hurt!
Then as FURTHER punishment, you are going to clean the church from tip to toe!
Whaaat?! Ugh... Fiiine...
For Ilia's sake, I hope this will teach him a lesson.
Hey, Estelle? Could you do that to me, too?
What? But those pranks weren't your fault...
Still, I made you upset, didn't I?
I think I'd feel like I made it up to you that way.
Well... If you insist...
...There.
Thanks. Now I feel less guilty.
Well, that's good. ...Although very strange.
The Loving Hand is supposed to make people reflect on their actions, and yet you feel absolved...
Heh. Well, this is a special case.
It's only your Loving Hand that could make me feel like that.
Oh... Well... Thank you...
(Only...mine...?)
Ilia teaches that love tolerates all things, is compassionate, never grows envious...
...endures all things, believes in all things, hopes for all things...
Thank you so much, Estelle.
Everyone in the village rejoiced in receiving the word of Ilia.
Not at all. I am a preacher; it is the least that I could do.
We look forward to your next sermon.
I'm glad to hear that. I am still studying, but I hope my passion will make up for my inexperience.
Phew...
That was great, Estelle.
Euden?! Were you listening?!
I sure was. The villagers were hanging on your every word!
Still, you must think I'm not really cut out for this kind of work...
Not at all. Though it is a side of you I'm not really used to seeing.
That's nice, but I have a long way to go until I reach the level I want to be at.
What level is that?
Well, the reason I wanted to become a preacher was because that's what my grandmother did.
When I was little, I was always getting into trouble.
Really? Heh. I never would've guessed, but I can kind of see it...
My grandmother was the kindest woman I'd ever met.
She hardly ever scolded me for being such a mischief-maker.
...Until the day I pulled a truly awful prank.
What happened?
I hurt someone.
Oh. What did your grandmother do?
She disciplined me—for the first time in my life.
Let me guess: the Loving Hand?
Yes. I remember it as if it were yesterday...
It hurt so much.
Er, but I thought the point of the Loving Hand was that it DOESN'T hurt.
The pain I felt was not physical.
It was an ache deep in my chest.
The very same anguish that I had inflicted on my grandmother.
So the Loving Hand conveys the pain in a person's heart?
Exactly! The Loving Hand is not supposed to hurt; rather, it is supposed to make someone understand the emotional pain that YOU feel.
That's kind of incredible.
Isn't it?!
Seeing you talk about your grandmother with such love makes me understand how wonderful she was.
Oh! N-now I'm embarrassed...
Why? There's nothing to be embarrassed about.
No, it's just... I have a bad habit of letting my emotions get the better of me.
I rely on the Loving Hand far too much.
But that's not a bad thing, is it?
It is unacceptable behavior for a preacher to engage in, Loving Hand or no.
I ought to be kind and compassionate, not let my temper get the better of me!
Well, that may be the right thing to do as a preacher...
But I like you just the way you are. I know you're trying the best you can.
Wh-what are you saying?!
Take THIS!
Augh! I'm so sorry! See, I just do it without thinking!
Ha ha! That's okay. It's just who you are.
And everyone loves you for who you are.
Y-you... You really are a villain!
*sigh* What do I do...
Is something wrong, Estelle? You look upset.
Oh, Euden... Well, it's the children...
The ones you're teaching, you mean?
Yes. Day in and day out, they keep pulling pranks—and they're getting worse.
Kids don't really know where to draw the line, do they?
Those children ought to know better!
Between my constant warnings and the Loving Hand, you'd think they'd have learned by now.
Maybe I'm just not able to get anything across to them after all.
Estelle, I—
Huh?!
What was that sound?! Let's go see...
Oh no, oh no! What should we dooo?
What CAN we do? It's EVERYWHERE!
All the ingredients and dishes are all messed up!
We're gonna get in trouble again...
What are you doing?!
Eeep!
It's not what it looks like, Reverend! R-right, everyone?
R-right! Yeah! We were just... Ummm...
I have had it up to here with you! You've gone too far this time!
You...
Let go of my arm, Euden!
At least listen to what they have to say, Estelle.
You're a preacher, right? That means, first and foremost, you talk.
I'm sorry!
Wait, Estelle!
Ugh...
So this is where you went... I was really worried when you ran off like that.
Leave me alone.
Okay, if that's what you want.
...You were right.
Hmm?
I'm a preacher. I should have resorted to words before anything else.
I'm...I'm a failure!
There was no way I was ever going to be as good of a preacher as my grandmother!
I don't think that's true.
But if you don't believe me, why not ask them?
Who?
Reverend...?
Children...
Um...here.
Is this...cake?
Yeah. Everyone helped bake it. We hope you like it...
You made this...for me?
Daddy always says that presents help people feel better, so...
We just wanted you to feel better.
Oh...
We tried really hard, but we kinda messed up baking it.
Sorry it didn't turn out that w-well... *sniffle* Waaaahhh!
We're sorryyyyy! Waaaaah!
Oh, my dear children...
See? They know you're doing your best.
You're getting through to them more than you think.
Maybe you're not exactly like your grandmother, but I still think you make a fine preacher.
Th...thank you.
*sniffle* S-sorry, Reverend.
Don't be. It's I who should apologize to all of you.
I am so sorry I never realized how hard you all were trying.
Y-you aren't gonna...?
Of course not! I am the one at fault.
So, if it's your fault, does that mean...
What? Oh. I suppose so.
Would you mind, Euden?
Wh-why me?
You were so worried about us, it seems only fitting.
Please.
All right. But promise us something. Me and the kids.
Promise you'll never give up trying to be the best preacher—and teacher—that you can be.
Of course!
Good. Right then, here goes...
...There.
